lines.line: Oh, thank Armadyl! I am in such a worry... please help me!
With what?
Oh... it is terrible... horrible... My boyfriend lives here in this lighthouse, but I haven't seen him the last few days! I think something terrible has happened!
Look, you can see for yourself that the light has gone out, and the front door is locked up tight! He would NEVER do that!
With the light off this coastline is terribly dangerous to ships! And to lock the front door so that nobody can turn the light back on?
Maybe he just went on holiday or something? Must be pretty boring living in a lighthouse.
That is terribly irresponsible! He is far too thoughtful for that! He would never leave it unattended! He would also never leave without telling me!
Please, I know something terrible has happened to him... I can sense it! Please... please help me adventurer!
But how can I help?
Well, we have to do something to get the lighthouse working again! Also, as you may have noticed, the storm that knocked the bridge out
has trapped me on this causeway! You seem to have got here okay somehow, so if you could go and visit my cousin and get the spare key I left him,
as well as fix the bridge enough so that I can go and speak to my family in Rellekka and tell them whats happened, I will be eternally grateful!
Okay, I'll help!
OH! THANK YOU SO MUCH! I know my darling would never have left with the lighthouse lights off and without even telling me where he's gone!
Where is your cousin?
My cousin was always interested in agility. He left our home in Rellekka many moons ago, so that he could pursue this interest.
I don't exactly know where he has gone, but I am sure he went somewhere to practise his agility. If you see him, his name is Gunnjorn. Mention my name, he will recognise it.
How can I fix the bridge?
Well, I am not just some helpless girl! I have pretty good agility, so you will only need to use two planks to make a ledge that I can balance along.
Just use a plank on each side of the bridge. You will need a hammer, and thirty steel nails for each plank you use as well. I believe there are some planks near here...
I'll see what I can do.
Thank you so much!
Sorry, just passing through.
Oh... my poor darling Jossik... I just know something terrible has happened...
Hello again.
Oh, please find my darling! I just know something horrible has happened!
Haha welcome to my obstacle course. Have fun, but remember this isn't a child's playground. People have died here.
Hi, are you called Gunnjorn?
Why, indeed I am. I own this agility course, it can be very dangerous!
Yeah, that's great. Anyway, I understand you have a cousin named Larrissa who gave you a key...?
Yes, she did! How do you know of this? She said she probably wouldn't need it, but gave it to me for safe keeping just in case.
Well, something has happened at the lighthouse, and she has been locked out. I need you to give me her key.
Well, I would give you the key, but apparently you don't have any room.
Sure. Here you go.
Welcome again to my obstacle course. Have fun, but remember this isn't a child's playground. People have died here.
Hello again, Gunnjorn. I'm afraid I've lost that key you gave me.
Well, I would give you another, but apparently you don't have any room.
No problem. Here you go.
What? My cousin is the one who gave you my spare copy of the lighthouse key. Do you have memory problems, adventurer?
Um... no... I was just... Testing you. Yeah. Testing.
I've got your key for you!
Thank you adventurer, but I need you to fix the bridge for me. The key to the lighthouse is of little comfort while I am trapped here on this causeway!
I've fixed the bridge for you!
Oh, thank you so much!
Please find the key to the lighthouse for me though!
I cannot bear to think that something bad may have happened to my darling Jossik...
Please adventurer... We are both curious as to what has happened in that lighthouse, but you need to fix the bridge for me!
Quickly, we must go inside and find out what has happened to my beloved Jossik!
This is terrible...
What can have happened here? Please, you must fix the light, we cannot let my darling Jossik take the blame for any shipwrecks!
Okay, I will see what I can do.
What am I supposed to be doing again?
You MUST find a way to fix the lighthouse! The ships are in terrible danger as long as the light is not working properly!
Do you have any idea how I could do that?
I'm sorry adventurer, I do not know anything about lighthouses.
I'm sure there must be some kind of user's guide around here somewhere though.
My darling Jossik knew nothing about Lighthouses when he first came here, so the council must have left him some kind of manual or something.
Adventurer! You MUST do something about the broken light!
It is terribly important that ships coming round this coastline do not crash here!
Please adventurer... Do not let curiosity get the better of you! We Have to fix the lighthouse before any accidents happen!
I have managed to fix the light!
Excellent work, adventurer!
Now you can devote all of your energies to finding out what has happened to my darling Jossik!
Have you found any sign of my darling Jossik yet?
Not yet...
I came out here to see if I could find some sign of him...
But there is nothing at all. I am so worried...
Don't worry, I'm sure he's fine. I'll find him somehow.
I don't think I'll get that back if I put it in there.
*cough* Please... please help me... I think my leg is broken, and those creatures will be back any minute now!
I guess you're Jossik then... What creatures are you talking about?
I... I do not know. I have never seen their like before!

I was searching for information about my uncle Silas, who vanished mysteriously from this lighthouse many months ago. I found the secret of that strange wall, and discovered that I could use it as a door, but when I
came down here I was attacked by...
Well, I do not know what they are, but they are very strong! They hurt me badly enough to trap me here, and I have been fearing for my life ever since!
Don't worry, I'm here now. Larrissa was worried about you and asked for my help.
I'll go back upstairs and let her know that I've found you and that you're still alive, and then we can work out some way of getting you out of here, okay?
NO! No, you can't leave me now! Look! They're coming again! Do something!
Okay, now that the creature's dead we can get you out of here.
No... you do not understand...
That was not the creature that attacked me...
That was one of its babies...
I found Jossik! He's in a cavern underground...
That is wonderful news! But why does he not come up out of there?
Um... well, there's a big monster down there with him stopping him leaving.
What?!?! You MUST save him! I beseech you, please! Do something!
Okay, okay, sheesh, keep your hair on...
Okay, it's dead! Let's get out of here!
Yes, quickly, the mother might be dead, but it's children are not!
Follow me upstairs, I might be able to help you with that casket you found.
Bring it to my library, it looks familiar somehow...

characters.name: Gunnjorn
characters.description: Middle-aged male, gruff Nordic accent, confident and matter-of-fact tone. A Barbarian who runs an agility course and takes his work seriously, with a dry sense of humor about the dangers of his obstacle course.

characters.name: Jossik
characters.description: Adult male, British accent, earnest and slightly nervous tone. A lighthouse keeper who is practical and dutiful, currently injured and frightened after being attacked by unknown creatures in the cavern below the lighthouse.

characters.name: Larrissa
characters.description: Young adult female, soft Nordic accent, anxious and pleading tone. A devoted Fremennik woman deeply worried about her missing boyfriend, her voice carries both vulnerability and underlying resolve.
